alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; De Witt; Gonzales; Lavaca; Travis; Williamson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 8:39PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Williamson, eastern Caldwell, north central DeWitt, east central Travis, Bastrop, Gonzales, Lee, Fayette and northwestern Lavaca Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 839 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Weir to near Coupland to near Rosanky to near Smiley. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Pflugerville, Taylor, Elgin, Cuero, Bastrop, Gonzales, Yoakum, Luling, Giddings, La Grange, Smithville, Schulenburg, Shiner, Flatonia, Lexington, Moulton, Hutto, Manor and Nixon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for south central Texas.

area.areaDesc: Caldwell; De Witt; Gonzales; Lavaca; Travis; Williamson
